kw.name: Start server and create new session
Start Process
kw.doc: Starts a new process on background.

kw.name: Set Local Variable
kw.doc: Makes a variable available everywhere within the local scope.

kw.name: Run
kw.doc: Runs the given command in the system and returns the output.

kw.name: Run Keyword And Ignore Error
kw.doc: Runs the given keyword with the given arguments and ignores possible error.

kw.name: GET
kw.doc: Sends a GET request.
kw.msg: GET Request : url=http://127.0.0.1:4000/assignments path_url=/assignments headers={'User-Agent': 'python-requests/2.22.0', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate', 'Accept': '*/*', 'Connection': 'keep-alive'} body=None

kw.name: Set Local Variable
kw.doc: Makes a variable available everywhere within the local scope.

kw.name: Exit For Loop
kw.doc: Stops executing the enclosing for loop.

kw.name: Fail
kw.doc: Fails the test with the given message and optionally alters its tags.

kw.doc: Create Session: create a HTTP session to a server

test.name: Scenario: Try to update a non existing assignment

kw.name: Given An assignment with id 14 does not exist in the system
kw.sourcename: An assignment with id ${id} does not exist in the system

kw.name: GET On Session
kw.doc: Sends a GET request on a previously created HTTP Session.
kw.msg: GET Request : url=http://127.0.0.1:4000/assignments/14 path_url=/assignments/14 headers={'User-Agent': 'python-requests/2.22.0', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate', 'Accept': '*/*', 'Connection': 'keep-alive'} body=None

kw.name: And The number of assignments in the system is "N"
Get list of assignments
GET On Session
kw.doc: Sends a GET request on a previously created HTTP Session.
kw.msg: GET Request : url=http://127.0.0.1:4000/assignments path_url=/assignments headers={'User-Agent': 'python-requests/2.22.0', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate', 'Accept': '*/*', 'Connection': 'keep-alive'} body=None

kw.name: Get From Dictionary
kw.doc: Returns a value from the given ``dictionary`` based on the given ``key``.
kw.msg: ${list_assign} = [{'description': 'To be updated', 'id': 13, 'name': 'Updated Task Name', 'price': 20, 'status': 'Update todo'}, {'description': 'To do something else', 'id': 11, 'name': 'Another Task', 'price': 1000,...

${list} = [{'description': 'To be updated', 'id': 13, 'name': 'Updated Task Name', 'price': 20, 'status': 'Update todo'}, {'description': 'To do something else', 'id': 11, 'name': 'Another Task', 'price': 1000,...

kw.name: Get Length
kw.doc: Returns and logs the length of the given item as an integer.

kw.name: Set Test Variable
kw.doc: Makes a variable available everywhere within the scope of the current test.

kw.name: When We update the name of the assignment with id 14 to "Updated Task Name"
kw.sourcename: We update the name of the assignment with id ${id} to "${name}"

kw.name: Create Dictionary
kw.doc: Creates and returns a dictionary based on the given ``items``.

kw.name: PUT On Session
kw.doc: Sends a PUT request on a previously created HTTP Session.
kw.msg: PUT Request : url=http://127.0.0.1:4000/assignments/14 path_url=/assignments/14 headers={'User-Agent': 'python-requests/2.22.0', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate', 'Accept': '*/*', 'Connection': 'keep-alive', 'Content-Length': '29', 'Content-Type': 'application/json'} body=b'{"name": "Updated Task Name"}'

kw.name: Set Test Variable
kw.doc: Makes a variable available everywhere within the scope of the current test.

kw.name: Then Server response should have status code 404
kw.sourcename: Server response should have status code ${status}

kw.name: Status Should Be
kw.doc: Fails if response status code is different than the expected.

kw.name: And An assignment with id 14 should not exist in the system
kw.sourcename: An assignment with id ${id} should not exist in the system

kw.name: GET On Session
kw.doc: Sends a GET request on a previously created HTTP Session.

kw.name: Status Should Be

kw.doc: Fails if objects are unequal after converting them to integers.
